title: How to access a USB drive on a Chromebook - Quora

response.answer_text: Insert the usb flash drive. Then go to “files” on your chromebook. In the left column, it will show the drives available. It will show “google drive” and along with that it should show your usb drive, Click on it to access the contents.

Q: Can you use a flash drive on a Chromebook? Yes. Providing the drive is in a format that the Chromebook understands it will appear in the file management tool on the Chromebook, from where you can work on the contents of the flash drive, or copy files to or from the drive to the Chromebook’s internal storage. If it is online, you can also copy files to or from the cloud storage (Google Drive) for the Chromebook account. Always use the ejection facility in the file management tool before unplugging the flash drive.
